result.execSummary:
The defendant Courtney B. Rivera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling or combination thereof of at least 30 hours per week.  If not, must perform 10 hours of community service per week.
Absolute sobriety except prescriptions taken as prescribed and taken with prior agent authorization.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as demed appropriate by the department. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Courtney B. Rivera

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 8:21 am 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person with Atty Paul Goetz.   
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to: 
Ct. 1 (Maintain Drug Trafficking Place/PTAC)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 1 year probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and taken with prior agent authorization; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2  of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours of community service per week; court costs. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to 4 days jail credit if revoked. 

Adj: 8:30 am

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Absolute sobriety. No controlled substances without a valid prescription and only in the amount prescribed. EMPD police escort to retrieve any personal belongings.   No contact with co-defendant(s): J.H., G.C., C.H., & J.G. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Reside at 1629 Kimball Street Ashland WI.
